cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 172 (Wednesday, November 20, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. CARAVEO:H.R. 10179.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Constitutional Authority--Necessary and Proper Clause (Art.I, Sec. 8, Clause 18)THE U.S. CONSTITUTIONARTICLE I, SECTION 8: POWERS OF CONGRESSCLAUSE 18The single subject of this legislation is:To direct the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development toaward grants to States to develop and expand theindustrialized construction of innovative residentialdwelling units, and for other purposes.[Page H6155]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: Innovative Housing Solutions and Affordability Act

item.title: Innovative Housing Solutions and Affordability Act
Innovative Housing Solutions and Affordability Act

To direct the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to award grants to States to develop and expand the industrialized construction of innovative residential dwelling units, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
